advisories.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability in projectworlds Online Admission System 1.0
advisories.description: This vulnerability allows an attacker to manipulate the 'keyword' argument in a PHP script, potentially leading to unauthorized database access and data modification.
advisories.recommendations: To mitigate this vulnerability, ensure that any input arguments passed to file /process_login.php are sanitized or validated against a predefined set of allowed keywords. This can be achieved by using prepared statements or parameterized queries when making database requests from PHP.

advisories.title: Password Generation Algorithm Vulnerability
advisories.description: An unauthenticated local attacker with knowledge of the password generation timeframe might be able to brute force the password in a timely manner, allowing them to gain root access to the device if the debug interface is still enabled.
advisories.recommendations: Implement a rate limiting mechanism on the password generation endpoint to limit the number of simultaneous requests, and validate user input to prevent brute-force attacks. Also, consider implementing a password blacklisting feature to block known compromised passwords.
